intro: Strobilanthes boerlagei var. densipila, commonly known as the dense-piled strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and requires high humidity and partial shade. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often displaying shades of red, purple, or white. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological significance in its native habitat.
